body_html:
@soumith yeah, so requests[security] installs the following:

  • requests
  • pyOpenSSL
  • cryptography
  • idna

So to check for it in the code, we could import one of the other libs but they will never be used directly.

Also, I think requests[security] is only necessary for certain versions of OSX where the openSSL version is too old, otherwise just using requests will work.
body_text:
@soumith yeah, so requests[security] installs the following:

requests
pyOpenSSL
cryptography
idna

So to check for it in the code, we could import one of the other libs but they will never be used directly.
Also, I think requests[security] is only necessary for certain versions of OSX where the openSSL version is too old, otherwise just using requests will work.
body:
@soumith yeah, so `requests[security]` installs the following:

- requests
- pyOpenSSL
- cryptography
- idna

So to check for it in the code, we could import one of the other libs but they will never be used directly. 

Also, I think `requests[security]` is only necessary for certain versions of OSX where the openSSL version is too old, otherwise just using `requests` will work.
